title: Recommending information sources to information seekers in Twitter

author: Marcelo G. Armentano, ISISTAN Research Institute, UNICEN

segmentation: Hello everybody.
I will present some preliminary work that we have done with Twitter.
All of you who use Twitter daily must know that finding information sources among the increasing number of users in Twitter is a difficult task.
So in this presentation I will talk about.
An approach we are working on in order in order to recommend information sources to information secrecy.
So what makes Twitter special for four Wheeler recommender system?
First of all then I will mention the second one here.
The restriction of 140 characters length in Twitters inputs.
In allow them to be received in any in almost any mobile device so users can get updated constantly with information they decide to read about.
Second, unlike many others online online social networks, connections in Twitter are non directed connections.
This means that when a user decides to follow another user, the connection does not need to be accepted or reciprocated.
So all users decide to read the information they want to read almost freely.
Previous studies that I have put the reference here have identified that there exists three categories of users in Twitter that are called information sources, information seekers and friends.
Information sources are characterized by having a lot number of followers.
And by publishing tweets actively.
Well, information seekers are characterized by having a lot of followers.
That is to follow a lot of people.
But having few followers themselves an in general they don't publish tweets very actively.
And only makes a retweets of tweets of other users.
And finally, friends are users that use this online social network to keeping in touch with other partners.
And our characterized by cutting bidirectional connection that I follow these people and these people follow.
